<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The LoM for each operation shown in the above table differs from that shown in &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Sibanye Gold&#146;s Mining Operations.&#148; The
	LoM in the above table is based on the above infrastructure proven and probable reserves, whereas the LoM information in &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Sibanye Gold&#146;s Mining Operations&#148; is based on both above and below
	infrastructure proven and probable reserves.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Below infrastructure reserves relate to mineralization which is located at a level at which an operation currently does not have infrastructure sufficient to allow
	mining operations to occur, but where the operation has made plans to install additional infrastructure in the future which will allow mining to occur at that level.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Rounding off of figures may result in minor computational discrepancies.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Corporate expenditure
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Corporate expenditure increased by U.S.$1.6
	million, or 24%, from U.S.$6.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$8.4 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. Corporate expenditure consists primarily of general corporate overhead and corporate service department costs,
	primarily in the areas of technical services, human resources and finance, which are used by the operations. Corporate expenditure also includes business development costs. In Rand terms, corporate expenditure increased by R17.3 million, or 35%
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	97
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	from R49.4 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to R66.7 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012 mainly due to reorganization of corporate services and inflation. Corporate
	expenditure represents costs charged by Gold Fields.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Employee termination costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Employee termination costs decreased by U.S.$24.3 million, or 76%, from U.S.$32.0 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to
	U.S.$7.7 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. The termination costs in the fiscal years ended December 2012 and 2011 related primarily to restructuring costs as part of the BPR program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Profit on disposal of property, plant and equipment
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit on disposal of property, plant and equipment decreased by U.S.$0.3 million, or 50%, from U.S.$0.6 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$ 0.3&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended
	December 2012. The major disposals in the fiscal year ended December 2012 related to sale of redundant assets at KDC and Beatrix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Increase/(decrease) in provision for post-retirement healthcare costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold provides medical benefits to employees in its operations through the Gold Fields Medical Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the medical plan, which covers certain of its former employees, Sibanye Gold remains liable for 50% of these retired
	employees&#146; medical contributions after their retirement. At December&nbsp;31, 2012, 126 (at December&nbsp;31, 2011: 128) former employees were covered under this plan. This benefit is not available to members of the scheme who were employees of
	the former Free State operation (which is now the Beatrix operation) who retired after August&nbsp;31, 1997, and other employees who retired after January&nbsp;31, 1999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended December 2012, U.S.$0.3 million was charged to earnings compared with a U.S.$0.1 million charge in respect of Sibanye Gold&#146;s obligations under these medical plans in the
	fiscal year ended December 2011. The U.S.$0.3 million and U.S.$0.1 million charges in the fiscal years ended December 2012 and 2011 comprise the annual interest and service charges. The post-retirement healthcare provision is updated annually based
	on actuarial calculations, with any increase in the provision reflected in the statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Accretion expense on provision
	for environmental rehabilitation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At both of its operations, Sibanye Gold makes full provision for environmental
	rehabilitation based on the net present value of the estimated cost of restoring the environmental disturbance that has occurred up to the balance sheet date. The rehabilitation charge increased by U.S.$0.5 million, or 4%, from U.S.$13.8 million in
	the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$14.3 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. The increase is due primarily to new disturbances partially offset by a decrease in the life of its mines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold contributes to an environmental trust fund it has established to provide for any environmental rehabilitation obligations
	and expected closure costs relating to its mining operations. The amounts invested in the trust funds are classified as non-current assets and any income earned on these assets is accounted for as interest income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Interest income
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest income decreased by U.S.$0.7 million, or 5%, from U.S.$13.6 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$12.9 million
	in the fiscal year ended December 2012. The decrease was mainly due to the weaker Rand, as the average Rand cash balances were higher in the fiscal year ended December 2012 compared to the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	98
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The interest received in the fiscal year ended December 2012 of U.S.$12.9 million comprised
	U.S.$8.6&nbsp;million on monies invested in the South African environmental rehabilitation trust funds and U.S.$4.3&nbsp;million on other cash and cash equivalent balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The interest received in the fiscal year ended December 2011 of U.S.$13.6 million comprised U.S.$9.2&nbsp;million on monies invested in the South African environmental rehabilitation trust funds and
	U.S.$4.4&nbsp;million on other cash and cash equivalent balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest received on the funds invested in rehabilitation
	trust funds decreased from U.S.$9.2 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$8.6 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012, mainly due to the weaker Rand as higher average cash balances were held in the fiscal year ended December
	2012 compared with the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest on cash balances decreased from U.S.$4.4 million in the
	fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$4.3 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012 mainly due to the weaker Rand as higher average cash balances were held in the fiscal year ended December 2012 compared with the fiscal year ended December
	2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Finance expense
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Finance expense increased by U.S.$12.5 million, or 625%, from U.S.$2.0 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$14.5 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The higher interest payments in the fiscal year ended December 2012 are due to interest charges on the R4,220.0 million (U.S.$492.5
	million) drawn down under the R2.0 billion Revolving Credit Facility, (R2,000.0&nbsp;million) (U.S.$233.4 million), the R1.5 billion Long Term Revolving Credit Facilities (R1,000.0&nbsp;million) (U.S.$116.7 million) and the Other Short Term Credit
	Facilities (R1,220.0 million) (U.S.$142.4 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Royalties
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Royalties decreased by U.S.$5.7 million, or 14%, from U.S.$40.1 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$34.4 million in the
	fiscal year ended December 2012. The lower royalties in the fiscal year ended December 2012 were due to decreased earnings on which the royalty formula is based.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Other expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other expenses represent miscellaneous corporate
	expenditure not allocated to the operations and therefore not included in the corporate expenditure line item, net of miscellaneous revenue items such as scrap sales and rental income. Other expenses increased by U.S.$7.5 million, or 23%, from
	U.S.$32.0 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$39.5 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. The increase in the fiscal year ended December 2012 was attributable to new bridge loan facility charges, long service awards,
	social contributions and the firefighting costs at the Ya Rona shaft during the fiscal year ended December 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other
	expenses in the fiscal year ended December 2012 and the fiscal year ended December 2011 consisted of share-based compensation, restructuring costs arising from the BPR program and facility fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	99
</FONT>
</P>

</I>
</B>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Income and mining tax expense decreased from U.S.$167.5 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to an income and mining tax benefit
	of U.S.$67.5 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. The table below sets forth Sibanye Gold&#146;s effective tax rate for the fiscal years ended December 2012 and December 2011, including normal and deferred tax.
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	33
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	%&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As noted in &#147;&#151;Overview&#151;Income and Mining Taxes&#148;, during the budget speech in February
	2012 the South African Minister of Finance announced that STC would be abolished. This resulted in there being only one gold mining formula to calculate mining income taxes. The revised formula was enacted on April&nbsp;1, 2012, with effect from
	January&nbsp;1, 2012, and resulted in a reduction in the maximum South African tax rate for mining companies from 43% to 34%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended December 2012, the effective tax benefit rate of 24% was lower than the new maximum South African mining
	statutory tax rate of 34.0% mainly due to the effect of a U.S.$34.5 million (12.2% of income before tax and share of equity investee&#146;s profit) reduction relating to the difference between the maximum rate and the actual rate arising from the
	application of the South African gold mining formula rate calculation, a U.S.$0.7 million adjustment to reflect the actual realized company tax rates and a U.S.$139.1&nbsp;million (49.1% of income before tax and share of equity investee&#146;s
	profit) deferred tax release on reduction of the estimated future tax rate for brought forward deferred tax liabilities due to the reduction in the maximum mining rate and consequent impact in the gold mining tax rate formula. This was offset by
	U.S.$10.0&nbsp;million (3.5% of income before tax and share of equity investee&#146;s profit) of non-taxable income/non-deductible expenditure comprising mainly share based compensation of U.S.$32.2 million (after tax effect of U.S.$10.9 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended December 2011, the effective tax expense rate of 33.3% was lower than the maximum South African
	mining statutory tax rate of 43.0% mainly due to the tax-effect of a U.S.$37.8 million reduction relating to the South African mining tax formula rate adjustment and a U.S.$25.4 million adjustment to reflect the actual realized company tax rates
	offset by U.S.$17.4 million of non-deductible expenditure comprising mainly share based compensation of U.S.$33.0 million (after tax effect of U.S.$14.2 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Share of equity investees&#146; profits/(losses)
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Share of equity
	investees&#146; profits increased from a profit of U.S.$4.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to a profit of U.S.$11.4 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012. Sibanye Gold accounts for its interest in Rand Refinery using the
	equity method of accounting. Sibanye Gold&#146;s equity interest of 33.1% in Rand Refinery was unchanged during the fiscal year ended December 2012 and&nbsp;December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Net income
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the factors discussed above, Sibanye
	Gold&#146;s net income increased by U.S.$21.6 million, or 6%, from U.S.$340.7 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 to U.S.$362.3 million in the fiscal year ended December 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Fiscal Years ended December 2011 and June 2010
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Product sales increased by U.S.$492.2 million, or 27.2%, from U.S.$1,808.8 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$2,301.0
	million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The increase in product sales was primarily due to an increase in the average realized gold price of 46.5% from U.S.$1,085 per ounce in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$1,590 per ounce in the
	fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	100
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gold sales decreased by 0.22&nbsp;million ounces, or 13.2%, from 1.67&nbsp;million ounces in
	the fiscal year ended June 2010 to 1.45&nbsp;million ounces in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, gold sales
	decreased by 0.18&nbsp;million ounces, or 14.1%, from 1.28&nbsp;million ounces in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to 1.10&nbsp;million ounces in the fiscal year ended December 2011 due to wage related industrial action and safety related stoppages,
	resulting in lower underground mining volumes at lower grades.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At Beatrix, gold sales decreased by 0.04&nbsp;million ounces,
	or 10.3%, from 0.39&nbsp;million ounces in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to 0.35&nbsp;million ounces in the fiscal year ended December 2011 mainly due to lower mining grade in the North section, lower volumes mined and lower mine call factor.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_36"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(1)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	102
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total cash cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote&nbsp;2&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total production cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote&nbsp;3&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(4)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The total may not reflect the sum of the line items due to rounding.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold&#146;s weighted average total cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$235 per ounce, or 32.2%, from U.S.$730 per ounce in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$965 per ounce in the fiscal
	year ended December 2011. The increase was as a result of the increase in electricity tariffs, inflationary increases, wage increases, the 4.7% strengthening of the Rand against the U.S. dollar and lower production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, the weighted average total cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$237 per ounce, or 32.6%, from U.S.$726 per ounce in the fiscal
	year ended June 2010 to U.S.$963 per ounce in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At Beatrix, the weighted average total
	cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$227 per ounce, or 30.6%, from U.S.$742 per ounce in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$969 per ounce in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The average total cash cost of South Deep in fiscal year ended June 2010 was U.S.$814 per ounce. The South Deep operation was distributed
	to Newshelf in December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Production costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Production costs increased by U.S.$129.8 million, or 10.5%, from U.S.$1,231.3 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$1,361.1 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. This increase was
	due to the 4.7% strengthening of the South African Rand against the U.S. dollar, inflationary increases, annual wage increases and increases in electricity tariffs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, production costs increased by U.S.$89.9 million, or 9.6%, from U.S.$936.9 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$1,026.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At Beatrix, production costs increased by U.S.$39.9 million, or 13.6%, from U.S.$294.4 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to
	U.S.$334.3 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Depreciation and amortization
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization charges increased by U.S.$45.7 million, or 16.4%, from U.S.$278.2 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010
	to U.S.$323.9 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. Depreciation and amortization is calculated on the units-of-production method and is based on current gold production as a percentage of total expected gold production over the lives of
	the different mines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, depreciation and amortization charges increased by U.S.$45.6 million, or 22.2%, from U.S.$205.1
	million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$250.7 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. At Beatrix, depreciation and amortization charges remained flat at U.S.$71.1 million. The increase at KDC was mainly due to the increase in the
	short life ore reserve development which is amortized over a shorter period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The table below depicts the changes from
	June&nbsp;30, 2010 to December&nbsp;31, 2011 for proven and probable reserves above current infrastructure and the LoM for each operation and the resulting impact on the amortization
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	103
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	charge. The LoM information is based on the operations&#146; strategic plans, adjusted for proven and probable reserve balances. In basic terms, amortization is calculated using the LoM for each
	operation, which is based on: (1)&nbsp;the proven and probable reserves above infrastructure for the operation at the start of the relevant year (which are taken to be the same as at the end of the prior fiscal year and using only above
	infrastructure reserves); and (2)&nbsp;the amount of gold produced by the operation during the year. The ore reserve statement as at December&nbsp;31, 2011 became effective on January&nbsp;1, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="28%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="5%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The LoM for each operation shown in the above table differs from that shown in &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Sibanye Gold&#146;s Mining Operations.&#148; The
	LoM in the above table is based on the above infrastructure proven and probable reserves, whereas the LoM information in &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Sibanye Gold&#146;s Mining Operations&#148; is based on both above and below
	infrastructure proven and probable reserves.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Below infrastructure reserves relate to mineralization which is located at a level at which an operation currently does not have infrastructure sufficient to allow
	mining operations to occur, but where the operation has made plans to install additional infrastructure in the future which will allow mining to occur at that level.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Corporate expenditure
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Corporate expenditure decreased by U.S.$18.5
	million, or 73.1%, from U.S.$25.3 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$6.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The decrease is mainly due to the strengthening of the Rand against the U.S. dollar and the effect of the
	corporate restructuring which commenced during the calendar year 2010. Corporate expenditure consists primarily of general corporate overhead and corporate service department costs, mainly in the areas of technical services, human resources and
	finance, which are used by the operations. Corporate expenditure also includes business development costs. In Rand terms, corporate expenditure decreased by R142.1 million, or 74.2%, from R191.5 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to R49.4
	million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 mainly due to the reallocation of costs to the operations as well as restructuring savings. Corporate expenditure represents costs charged by Gold Fields.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Employee termination costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Employee termination costs increased by U.S.$22.8 million, or 247.8%, from U.S.$9.2 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$32.0 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 mainly due to
	significant voluntary separation packages. The termination costs in the fiscal years ended December 2011 and June 2010 related primarily to restructuring as part of the BPR program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	104
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Profit on disposal of property, plant and equipment
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit on disposal of property, plant and equipment increased by U.S.$0.4 million, or 200%, from U.S.$0.2&nbsp;million in the fiscal year
	ended June 2010 to U.S.$0.6 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The major disposals in the fiscal year ended
	December 2011 related to the sale of redundant assets at KDC and, in the fiscal year ended June 2010, related to the sale of surplus housing at Beatrix and redundant assets at KDC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Increase/(decrease) in provision for post-retirement healthcare costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold provides medical benefits to employees in its operations through the Gold Fields Medical Scheme.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the medical plan which covers certain of its former employees, Sibanye Gold remains liable for 50%&nbsp;of these retired
	employees&#146; medical contributions after their retirement. At December&nbsp;31, 2011, 128 (June&nbsp;30, 2010: 166) former employees were covered under this plan. This benefit is not available to members of the scheme who were employees of the
	former Free State operation (which is now the Beatrix operation) who retired after August&nbsp;31, 1997, and other employees who retired after January&nbsp;31, 1999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Until its distribution in December 2010, Sibanye Gold had an additional post-retirement health care cost liability relating to South Deep employees. Former employees of South Deep belonged to a commercial
	medical scheme with employer liability for contribution per pensioner limited to R400 per month, which contribution was fixed until the termination of the obligation on December&nbsp;31, 2011. This obligation was subsequently transferred as part of
	the South Deep distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended December 2011, U.S.$0.1 million was charged to earnings compared with a
	U.S.$9.2 million credit to earnings in respect of Sibanye Gold&#146;s obligations under these medical plans in the fiscal year ended June 2010. The U.S.$0.1 million charge in the fiscal year ended December 2011 comprises the annual interest and
	service charge. The U.S.$9.2 million credit comprises the annual interest and service charge and a decrease in the cross subsidization liability, partly due to the buy-out of 22 members. The post-retirement healthcare provision is updated annually
	based on actuarial calculations, with any increase in the provision reflected in the statement of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Accretion expense on
	provision for environmental rehabilitation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At all of its mining operations, Sibanye Gold makes full provision for
	environmental rehabilitation based on the net present value of the estimated cost of restoring the environmental disturbance that has occurred up to the balance sheet date. The rehabilitation charge increased by U.S.$3.3 million, or 31.4%, from
	U.S.$10.5 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$13.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The increase was due primarily to the effect of higher future estimated inflation, used in calculating future closure costs, for the
	fiscal year ended December 2011 compared to the fiscal year ended June 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold contributes to environmental trust
	funds it has established to provide for any environmental rehabilitation obligations and expected closure costs relating to its mining operations. The amounts invested in the trust funds are classified as non-current assets and any income earned on
	these assets is accounted for as interest income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Interest income
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest income decreased by U.S.$19.0 million, or 58.3%, from U.S.$32.6 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$13.6 million
	in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The decrease was mainly due to lower cash balances and interest rates in the fiscal year ended December 2011 compared to the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	105
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage113"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The interest received in the fiscal year ended December 2011 of U.S.$13.6 million comprised
	U.S.$9.2&nbsp;million on monies invested in the environmental trust funds and U.S.$4.4 million on other cash and cash equivalent balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The interest received in the fiscal year ended June 2010 of U.S.$32.6 million comprised U.S.$8.0 million on monies invested in the environmental trust funds and U.S.$24.6 million on other cash and cash
	equivalent balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest received on the funds invested in rehabilitation trust funds increased from U.S.$8.0 million in
	the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$9.2 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011 mainly due to an interest adjustment on maturity, in November 2011, of a consumer-price-index-linked security comprising the trust fund investment portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest on cash balances decreased from U.S.$24.6 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$4.4&nbsp;million in the
	fiscal year ended December 2011 mainly due to average lower cash balances in the fiscal year ended December 2011 compared with the fiscal year ended June 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Finance expense
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Finance expense decreased by U.S.$25.2 million, or
	92.6%, from U.S.$27.2 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$2.0 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The decrease was primarily due to repayment of all borrowings external to the Sibanye Gold Group as well as repayment of
	interest bearing debt owed to Gold Fields.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Royalties
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Royalties increased by U.S.$32.5 million, or 427.6%, from U.S.$7.6 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$40.1 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The royalties were lower in the
	fiscal year ended June 2010 because the Royalty Act only came into operation from March&nbsp;1, 2010. The royalty for the fiscal year ended December 2011 reflected the full year&#146;s charge.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Other expenses
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other expenses represent miscellaneous corporate expenditure not allocated to the operations and therefore not included in the corporate
	expenditure line item, net of miscellaneous revenue items such as scrap sales and rental income. Other expenses increased by U.S.$12.7 million, or 65.8%, from U.S.$19.3 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$32.0 million in the fiscal
	year ended December 2011. The increase in the fiscal year ended December 2011 was in part attributable to the stronger Rand against the U.S. dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other expenses in the fiscal year ended December 2011 and the fiscal year ended June 2010 consisted of share-based compensation costs, loan facility charges and restructuring costs as part of the business
	process re-engineering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Income and mining tax expense
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Income and mining tax expense increased by U.S.$83.2 million, or 98.7%, from U.S.$84.3 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$167.5 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. The table
	below sets forth Sibanye Gold&#146;s effective tax rate for the fiscal years ended December 2011 and June 2010, including normal and deferred tax.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	106
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended December 2011, the effective tax expense rate of 33.3% was lower
	than the maximum South African mining statutory tax rate of 43.0% mainly due to the tax-effect of a U.S.$37.8 million reduction relating to the South African mining tax formula rate adjustment and a U.S.$25.4 million adjustment to reflect the actual
	realized company tax rates offset by U.S.$17.4 million of non-deductible expenditure comprising mainly share based compensation of U.S.$14.2 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the fiscal year ended June 2010, the effective tax expense rate of 34.8% was lower than the maximum South African mining statutory tax rate of 43.0% mainly due to the tax effect of a U.S.$16.6 million
	reduction relating to the South African mining tax formula rate adjustment and a U.S.$10.6 million adjustment to reflect the actual realized company tax rates offset by U.S.$10.8 million of non-deductible expenditure, comprising mainly U.S.$14.3
	million stock-based compensation partly offset by various non taxable items.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Share of equity investee&#146;s profits/(losses)
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Share of equity investee&#146;s profits decreased by U.S.$3.6 million, or 42.9%, from U.S.$8.4 million in the fiscal
	year ended June 2010 to U.S.$4.8 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011. Sibanye Gold accounts for its interest in Rand Refinery using the equity method of accounting. Sibanye Gold&#146;s equity interest of 33.1% (excluding 1.8% interest
	owned by South Deep) in Rand Refinery was unchanged during the fiscal year ended June 2010 and the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Net
	income from continuing operations
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the factors discussed above, Sibanye Gold&#146;s net income from
	continuing operations increased by U.S.$174.4 million, or 104.9%, from U.S.$166.3 million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$340.7&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Net loss from discontinued operation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a consequence of the
	distribution of South Deep, net loss from discontinued operation in the fiscal year ended June 2010 was U.S.$28.7 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the fiscal year ended June 2010, South Deep sold 0.26&nbsp;million ounces at an average gold price of U.S.$1,090 per ounce,
	resulting in product revenues of U.S.$288.7 million partly offset by production costs of U.S.$219.1 million. Other operating and non operating costs were U.S.$95.3 million comprising mainly:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	U.S.$59.5 million depreciation and amortization;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	U.S.$3.8 million corporate expenditure; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	U.S.$22.9 million net finance expense comprising U.S.$29.4 million gross interest payments and U.S.$6.5 million capitalized interest in respect
	of South Deep&#146;s mine development and ventilation shaft deepening projects. Gross interest payments of U.S.$29.4 million comprised U.S.$24.4 million on borrowings to fund capital requirements and U.S.$5.0 million forward cover costs on a foreign
	exchange contract taken out on the split-tenor revolving credit facility, (see&#148;&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#151;Credit Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the above, the loss before taxes was U.S.$25.7 million. Deferred income and mining taxes raised were U.S.$3.0 million
	resulting in net loss from discontinued operation of U.S.$28.7 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Net income
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of the factors discussed above, Sibanye Gold&#146;s net income increased by U.S.$203.1 million, or 147.6%, from U.S.$137.6
	million in the fiscal year ended June 2010 to U.S.$340.7 million in the fiscal year ended December 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	107
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage115"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Six-Month Periods Ended December 2010 and December 2009
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2010, as a result of a change in the fiscal year end of our parent company, Gold Fields, we changed our fiscal year end from
	June&nbsp;30 to December&nbsp;31 beginning in 2011. Financial statements for Sibanye Gold for the six-month period ended December 2009 have not been prepared and are not readily available. As a result, this &#147;Operating and Financial Review and
	Prospects&#148; contains a discussion of the results of operations of Sibanye Gold during the six-month transition period ended December 2010 on a standalone basis. However, in order to provide investors with information relevant to our results of
	operations during the six-month transition period ended December 2010 compared to the unaudited six-month period ended December 2009, we have provided the following discussion of the financial measures that are the primary metrics used in
	management&#146;s assessment of factors and trends which have had, and are anticipated to have, a material effect on results of operations. For the avoidance of doubt, the discussion below does not include any financial or operating information
	related to South Deep since it was transferred from Sibanye Gold to another company within the Gold Fields Group during December 2010 and was accounted for as a discontinued operation for the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and the
	six-month period ended December 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following tables set out Sibanye Gold&#146;s revenue and a reconciliation of
	Sibanye Gold&#146;s production costs to its total cash cost and total production cost for the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and the six-month period ended December 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The total may not reflect the sum of the line items due to rounding.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total cash cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote 1&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total production cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote&nbsp;2&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(4)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Calculated using an exchange rate of R7.65 per U.S.$1.00.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Product sales increased by U.S.$139.3 million, or 14.9%,
	from U.S.$934.1 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$1,073.4 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. The increase in product sales was due to the increased gold price from U.S.$1,024 per ounce in the
	six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$1,284 per ounce in the six-month transition period ended December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gold
	sales decreased by 0.07&nbsp;million ounces, or 7.7%, from 0.91&nbsp;million ounces in the six-month period ended December 2009 to 0.84&nbsp;million ounces in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. At KDC and Beatrix, gold sales
	decreased by 0.06&nbsp;million ounces, or 8.6%, from 0.70&nbsp;million ounces to 0.64&nbsp;million ounces and by 0.01&nbsp;million ounces, or 4.8%, from 0.21&nbsp;million ounces to 0.20&nbsp;million ounces, respectively, due to lower grades mined
	and processed and lower mining volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Production costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Production costs increased by U.S.$77.2 million, or 12.5%, from U.S.$616.6 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to
	U.S.$693.8 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. This increase was due to above inflation wage increases, an increase in electricity tariffs of 27.5%, an increase in employee termination costs mainly due to voluntary
	retrenchments and the introduction of royalties as from March&nbsp;1, 2010 together with an increase in amortization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	109
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage117"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, production costs increased by U.S.$58.1 million, or 12.5%, from U.S.$465.2 million
	in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$523.3 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At
	Beatrix, production costs increased by U.S.$19.1 million, or 12.6%, from U.S.$151.4 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$170.5 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Depreciation and amortization
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization charges increased by U.S.$27.9 million, or 19.8%, from U.S.$140.9 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$168.8 million in the six-month transition period
	ended December 2010. Depreciation and amortization is calculated on the units-of-production method and is based on current gold production as a percentage of total expected gold production over the lives of the different mines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, depreciation and amortization charges increased by U.S.$29.6 million, or 28.9%, from U.S.$102.5 million in the six-month period
	ended December 2009 to U.S.$132.1 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. This increase was due mainly to a decrease in estimated gold reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At Beatrix, depreciation and amortization charges decreased by U.S.$0.6 million, or 1.6%, from U.S.$37.3 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$36.7 million in the six-month
	transition period ended December 2010. This decrease was mainly due to the decrease in gold production.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Total Cash Cost and Total
	Production Cost per Ounce
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets out Sibanye Gold&#146;s total ounces sold and weighted average
	total cash costs and total production cost per ounce for the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and the six-month period ended December 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total cash cost per ounce, see &#147;Key&nbsp;Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote 2&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total production cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote&nbsp;3&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The total may not reflect the sum of the line items due to rounding.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold&#146;s weighted average total cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$206 per ounce, or 31.1%, from U.S.$662 per ounce in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$868 per ounce in the
	six-month transition period ended December 2010. This increase was as a result of a 7.7% decrease in gold production together with a 6.7% strengthening of the Rand against the U.S. dollar, above inflation wage increases and a 27.5% increase in
	electricity tariffs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	110
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At KDC, the weighted average total cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$205, or 31.3%, from
	U.S.$655 per ounce in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$860 per ounce in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. At Beatrix, the weighted average total cash cost per ounce increased by U.S.$184 per ounce, or 26.9%, from
	U.S.$684 per ounce in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$868 per ounce in the six-month transition period ended December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	111
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage119"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NCE increased from U.S.$808.5 million in the six-month period ended December 2009 to
	U.S.$945.1 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010, primarily due to, as noted above under &#147;&#151;Production Costs&#148;, above inflation wage increases, an increase in electricity tariffs of 27.5%, an increase in
	employee termination costs mainly due to voluntary retrenchments and the introduction of royalties as from March&nbsp;1, 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NCE per ounce increased from U.S.$886 per ounce in the six-month period ended December 2009 to U.S.$1,131 per ounce in the six-month
	transition period ended December 2010, primarily due to the lower production, the increased costs noted above and increased capital expenditure. The increase in capital expenditure was due to the effect of converting Rand expenditure into U.S.
	dollars at a stronger Rand / U.S. dollar exchange rate, from R7.65 in the six-month period ended December 2009 to R7.14 in the six-month transition period ended December 2010, as well as increased expenditure on the KDC mobile milling plant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Six-Month Transition Period Ended December 2010
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Product sales were U.S.$1,073.4 million in the six-month
	transition period ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. The average realized gold price was U.S.$1,284 per ounce. Gold sales were 0.84&nbsp;million ounces comprising 0.64&nbsp;million ounces at KDC and 0.20&nbsp;million ounces at Beatrix.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_46"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	ounce for the audited six-month transition period ended December 2010.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Note:
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Calculated using an average exchange rate of R7.14 per U.S.$1.00 for the period.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total cash cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote 2&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on how Sibanye Gold has calculated total production cost per ounce, see &#147;Key Information&#151;Selected Historical Consolidated Financial
	Data&#151;Statement of Operations Data&#151;Footnote&nbsp;3&#148;.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(4)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The total may not reflect the sum of the line items due to rounding.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold&#146;s weighted average total cash cost were U.S.$868 per ounce in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. This total cash cost was affected by above inflation wage increases and
	an increase in electricity tariffs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Production costs
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Production costs were U.S.$693.8 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. Production costs include labor and contractor costs, stores, power and energy costs and other mine direct
	overheads.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Depreciation and amortization
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization charges were U.S.$168.8 million in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. Depreciation and amortization is calculated on the units-of-production method and is
	based on current gold production as a percentage of total expected gold production over the lives of the different mines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Depreciation and amortization charges were U.S.$132.1 million at KDC and U.S.$36.7 million at Beatrix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The table below depicts the proven and probable reserves above current infrastructure and for the life of mine for each operation, and
	the resulting impact on the amortization charge in the six-month transition period ended December 2010. The life of mine information is based on the operations&#146; strategic plans, adjusted for proven and probable reserve balances. In basic terms,
	amortization is calculated using the LoM for each operation, which is based on: (1)&nbsp;the proven and probable reserves above infrastructure for the operation at the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	113
</FONT>
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	start of the relevant period (which are taken to be the same as at the end of the prior period and using only above infrastructure reserves); and (2)&nbsp;the amount of gold produced by the
	operation during the period. The ore reserve statement as at December&nbsp;31, 2010 became effective after January&nbsp;1, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
