<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Related Party Transactions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold entered into related party transactions with Rand Refinery, GF Group Services, GFO, GFL, GFLMS and other Gold Fields Group subsidiaries. The transactions with these related parties were
	generally conducted with terms comparable to transactions with third parties; however, in certain circumstances such as related party loans, the transactions were not at arm&#146;s length.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Rand Refinery
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Rand Refinery, in which Sibanye Gold holds a 33.1% interest,
	has an agreement with the Sibanye Gold Group, whereby it refines all the Sibanye Gold Group&#146;s gold production. Nicholas J. Holland, a former Director, was an alternate director of Rand Refinery and has held this directorship since
	September&nbsp;30, 2008. Prior to this date, he had been a director of Rand Refinery since July&nbsp;10, 2000. Sibanye Gold paid Rand Refinery $1.6&nbsp;million, $1.7 million, $0.8 million and $1.3 million in refining fees for the fiscal year ended
	December 2012, the fiscal year ended December 2011, the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and fiscal year ended June 2010, respectively. No dividends were received during the fiscal year ended December 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Gold Fields Group
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	GFLMS
	accounted for a significant portion of related party loans with the Sibanye Gold Group. These loans were U.S.$2.0 billion, U.S.$2.6 billion, U.S.$3.3 billion and U.S.$2.9 billion in the fiscal year ended December 2012, the fiscal year ended December
	2011, the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and the fiscal year ended June 2010, respectively. These loans were unsecured, interest-free and had no fixed terms of repayment. The loan was repaid on February 1, 2013, as detailed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On February&nbsp;1, 2013, Gold Fields subscribed for further shares in Sibanye Gold at a subscription price of
	R17,245,786,016.46. Sibanye Gold used the majority of the proceeds of such subscription amount to repay the intercompany loan to GFLMS, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Gold Fields. Gold Fields subscribed for such number of shares in Sibanye Gold so
	that, following such subscription, the number of issued shares held by Gold Fields in Sibanye Gold equaled the number of issued shares in Gold Fields. Sibanye Gold will use the remaining portion of the proceeds of such subscription to establish a
	cell captive to continue to cover insurance exposures for risk categories including asset and liability claims that are typically denominated in U.S. dollars, which were covered under Gold Fields&#146; cell captive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold was a wholly-owned subsidiary of Gold Fields up to February 18, 2013. As indicated below, some transactions that were
	related party transactions during the fiscal year might have stopped, been cancelled or settled or might continue as detailed below. Following the Spin-off, Gold Fields and Sibanye Gold continue to provide services to each other as described in the
	Transitional Services Agreement For more information regarding the Transitional Services Agreement, see &#147;Additional Information&#151;Material Contracts&#151;Transitional Services Agreement&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	GF Group Services charges a management fee relating to the provision of corporate services such as financial reporting, treasury, tax and
	legal services, secretarial, technical services and human resources. Corporate expenditure costs are determined based on the time spent by the corporate staff on providing the above mentioned services to the Sibanye Gold Group. Corporate expenditure
	was $8.4 million, $6.8 million, $10.3&nbsp;million and $25.3 million for the fiscal years ended December 2012 and 2011, the six-month transition period ended December 2010 and the fiscal year ended June 2010, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Sibanye Gold Group has a service-level arrangement with GF Group Services, which provides, among other services, payroll, procurement
	and payment services. GF Group Services, which accounts for the significant balance of related party accounts receivable at each reporting date, is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Gold Fields. The accounts receivable balances represent the value of
	services paid for by the Sibanye Gold Group that is recoverable from GF Group Services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	146
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At December 31, 2011 a significant portion of related party payables reflects amounts owing
	to GFO for the South Deep operation by the Group. As part of the service level agreement, the Group provides services related to South Deep&#146;s working capital and capital requirements i.e. procurement, payroll and financial services. In order to
	fund these working capital and capital requirements, the Group draws down amounts on behalf of South Deep via the Gold Fields treasury department.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Group&#146;s related party accounts receivable balance of $64.0 million and $27.8 million at December 31, 2012 and 2011, respectively, consists of $15.9 million (2011: $16.3 million) owed by Gold
	Fields Group Services as discussed above; $33.9 million (2011:$1.6 million) owed by South Deep Mine; $6.9 million (2011:&nbsp;$1.3 million) owed by Abosso Goldfields Limited and $7.3 million (2011: $8.5 million) owed by a number of other
	subsidiaries of Gold Fields related to services provided by the Group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Alexander Forbes Group
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gold Fields, of which Sibanye Gold was a wholly-owned subsidiary during fiscal 2012, has an agreement with the Alexander Forbes Group, or
	Alexander Forbes, pursuant to which Alexander Forbes manages Gold Fields&#146; employee defined contribution fund. Further, Guardrisk, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Alexander Forbes, manages Gold Fields&#146; local short-term insurance policies.
	Sibanye Gold has also obtained financial guarantees in favor of the South African Department of Mineral Resources from Alexander Forbes to partially secure the estimated rehabilitation costs at its operations. M. Sello Moloko, who was a
	non-executive director of Gold Fields until his resignation on December&nbsp;31, 2012, has been a non-executive director of Alexander Forbes from December 2007. As a director of Gold Fields, Mr.&nbsp;Moloko declared his interest in the agreement
	between Alexander Forbes and Gold Fields pursuant to South African requirements, and did not participate in the decision of Alexander Forbes to enter into the agreement with Gold Fields.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Credit Suisse
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On April&nbsp;17, 2012, Sibanye Gold, Orogen and GFO,
	subsidiaries of Gold Fields (the former parent of Sibanye Gold), entered into a U.S.$500 million syndicated revolving loan facility.&nbsp;The purpose of the facility was to refinance existing facilities and for general corporate and working capital
	purposes. Credit Suisse AG, London Branch, or Credit Suisse, was a lender under the U.S.$500 million syndicated revolving loan facility.&nbsp;See &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#151;Credit
	Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;U.S.$500 million Syndicated Revolving Credit Facility&#148; for further details regarding this facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Richard P. Menell, who is both a senior advisor to Credit Suisse Securities Jhb Ltd and a non-executive director of Gold Fields and Sibanye Gold has been a director of Credit Suisse Securities Jhb Ltd
	since September 2012.&nbsp;As a director of Gold Fields, Mr.&nbsp;Menell declared his interest in the above mentioned agreements between Credit Suisse and Gold Fields, pursuant to South African requirements, and did not participate in the decision
	of Credit Suisse to enter into the agreements with Gold Fields.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Guarantees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the fiscal year ended December 2012, Sibanye Gold guaranteed certain debt of other entities within the Gold Fields Group. For
	information on Sibanye Gold&#146;s guarantees, see &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#151;Credit Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;U.S.$1 billion Syndicated Revolving Credit
	Facility&#148;, &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Credit Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;U.S.$500 million Syndicated Revolving Credit Facility&#148;, &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Credit
	Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;R2.0 billion Revolving Credit Facility&#148;, &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Credit Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;R1.5 billion Long Term Revolving Credit
	Facilities&#148; and &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Credit Facilities and Other Capital Resources&#151;Guarantees&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Indemnity Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Each of Gold Fields and the other Guarantors have entered into the Indemnity Agreement in favor of Sibanye Gold, in order to indemnify Sibanye Gold, with effect from February&nbsp;18, 2013, against any
	loss caused to Sibanye Gold in circumstances where Sibanye Gold is required to make a payment to noteholders or the trustee of the Notes by virtue of its guarantee of the Notes (whether such loss is made prior to or after February&nbsp;18, 2013 or
	whether the circumstances giving rise to such loss arose prior to or after such date). The Indemnity Agreement will remain in place for as long as Sibanye Gold&#146;s guarantee obligations under the Notes remain in place. However, if there is an
	event of default and monies payable under the Notes are accelerated and Gold Fields cannot or does not meet its obligation to indemnify Sibanye Gold for all or part of its guarantee, Sibanye Gold may become liable for the full amount of the
	guarantee. Among other things, if Sibanye Gold is required to make any payment pursuant to its guarantee under the Notes, this would constitute an event of default or a breach of Sibanye Gold&#146;s other financing facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For further information on the Indemnity Agreement see &#147;Additional Information&#151;Material Contracts&#151;Indemnity
	Agreement&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	None of the Directors, officers or major shareholders of Sibanye Gold or, to the knowledge of Sibanye
	Gold&#146;s management, their families, had any interest, direct or indirect, in any transaction during the last three fiscal years or in any proposed transaction which has affected or will materially affect Sibanye Gold or its investment interests
	or subsidiaries, other than as stated above. None of the Directors or officers of Sibanye Gold or any associate of such Director or officer is currently, or has been at any time during the past three fiscal years, materially indebted to Sibanye
	Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	Interests of Experts and Counsel
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D475028D20F_HTM_ROM475028_10">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;8: FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Reference is made to Item&nbsp;18 for a list of all financial statements filed as part of this annual report. For information on legal
	proceedings, please refer to &#147;Information on the Company&#151;Legal Proceedings&#148; above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dividend Policy and Dividend
	Distributions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold may make distributions from time to time, provided that any such distribution is pursuant to an
	existing legal obligation of Sibanye Gold, a court order or has been authorized by resolution of the Board and (save in the case of a
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	distribution to all shareholders (except one which results in shareholders holding shares in an
	unlisted entity which requires the sanction of an ordinary resolution), cash dividends paid out of retained income, capitalization issues or scrip dividends incorporating an election to receive either capitalization shares or cash) has been
	sanctioned by ordinary resolution, and provided further that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	dividends be paid to shareholders registered as at a date subsequent to the date of declaration or date of confirmation of the dividend, whichever is
	the later;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	it reasonably appears that Sibanye Gold will satisfy the &#145;solvency and liquidity&#146; test as set out in the Companies Act immediately after
	completing the proposed distribution;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the Board of Gold Fields, by resolution, has acknowledged that it has applied the &#145;solvency and liquidity&#146; test and has reasonably concluded
	that Sibanye Gold would satisfy the &#145;solvency and liquidity&#146; test immediately after completing the proposed distribution; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	no obligation is imposed by Sibanye Gold, if it is a distribution of capital, that such capital be used to subscribe for shares in Sibanye Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold must complete any such distribution fully within 120 business days after the Board
	acknowledges that the &#145;solvency and liquidity&#146; test has been applied as aforesaid, failing which it must again comply with the above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold must hold all unclaimed distributions due to the shareholders of Sibanye Gold in trust indefinitely, but subject to the laws of prescription, and accordingly may release any distributions
	once the prescriptive period in relation to those dividends has expired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All dividends paid by Sibanye Gold were historically
	paid to Gold Fields. The aggregate amounts of these distributions were U.S.$59.0 million, U.S.$177.1 million, U.S.$121.0 million, U.S.$49.6 million, U.S.$335.6 million and U.S.$95.5 million for the fiscal years ended June&nbsp;30, 2008, 2009 and
	2010, the six-month transition period ended December 2010, and the fiscal year ended December 2011 and 2012, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In
	December 2010, Sibanye Gold distributed 100% of its share holding in the South Deep operation (through its ownership of subsidiaries&#151;GFO and GFIJVH&#151;which in turn owned 50% of South Deep each) to Newshelf, a related entity and a
	wholly-owned subsidiary company of Gold Fields. The distribution was effected by way of a dividend in-specie to Newshelf. The distribution was a spin&#150;off to Gold Fields, the majority shareholder in Sibanye Gold, and was accordingly accounted
	for at historical carrying amounts of the net assets of South Deep. The total distribution amounted to $2,949.7 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	Board has adopted a new dividend policy of between 25% and 35% of normalized earnings. Sibanye Gold defines normalized earnings as net earnings excluding gains and losses on foreign exchange, financial instruments, non-recurring items and share of
	result of associates after royalties and taxation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In accordance with the Bridge Loan Facilities, Sibanye Gold is not
	entitled to distribute any dividends, shares or other assets to its shareholders without the consent of the majority lenders under the Bridge Loan Facilities, except for a final dividend in respect of the fiscal year ending December 2013, which will
	be limited to 25% of normalized earnings and will be payable only if Sibanye Gold gross debt will not be more than R4 billion after such dividend payment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	149
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under South African law and subject to the provisions of the Bridge Loan Facilities, Sibanye
	Gold will be entitled to pay a dividend or similar payment to its shareholders only if it meets the solvency and liquidity tests set out in the Companies Act, and we are permitted to do so in terms of the Memorandum of Incorporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There is no arrangement under which future dividends are waived or agreed to be waived.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	Significant Changes

	Please refer to &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Recent Developments&#148;.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D475028D20F_HTM_ROM475028_11">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;9: THE OFFER AND LISTING
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Listing Details
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	principal non-United States trading market for the ordinary shares of Sibanye Gold is the JSE, on which they trade under the symbol &#147;SGL.&#148; Sibanye Gold&#146;s American depositary shares, or ADSs, currently trade in the United States on the
	NYSE under the symbol &#147;SBGL.&#148; The ADRs, representing the ADSs are issued by The Bank of New York Mellon, as Depositary. Each ADS represents four ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

	trading information on a monthly basis for each full month (or partial month, as the case may be) since our shares commenced trading on February&nbsp;11, 2013, as reported by Bloomberg.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Mechanics of the Spin-off
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Spin-off was governed by, and carried out in accordance with, the JSE Listing Requirements and the Companies Act. It was implemented as a
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	distribution of shares by Gold Fields to its
	shareholders. Under section&nbsp;46 of the Companies Act, the
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	distribution of shares must have been approved by the board of directors of Gold Fields and could only be given effect to if it reasonably appeared that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	the assets of Gold Fields, as fairly valued, equaled or exceeded the liabilities of Gold Fields, as fairly valued; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	Gold Fields would be able to pay its debts as they become due in the ordinary course of business for a period of 12 months after the
	distribution was implemented.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Companies Act requires that the board of directors of Gold Fields
	acknowledge, by resolution, that they are satisfied that the above requirements are fulfilled in order for the Spin-off to proceed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In anticipation of the Spin-off, Gold Fields converted the authorized and issued share capital of Sibanye Gold from shares with par value to no par value shares and increased the authorized share capital
	by the creation of an additional 999,999,000 ordinary shares with no par value. On February&nbsp;1, 2013, Gold Fields subscribed for
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	151
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	further shares in Sibanye Gold at a subscription price of R17,245.8 million. Sibanye Gold used a portion of the proceeds of such subscription amount to repay an intercompany loan to GFLMS, a
	wholly-owned subsidiary of Gold Fields. Gold Fields subscribed for such number of shares in Sibanye Gold so that, following such subscription, the number of issued shares held by Gold Fields in Sibanye Gold equaled the number of issued shares in
	Gold Fields. Following such subscription, the stated capital account of Sibanye Gold exceeded the minimum share capital requirement prescribed by the JSE of R25,000,000.00. On the Spin-off date, all of the Sibanye Gold shares, including those
	subscribed for by Gold Fields, were distributed by Gold Fields to its shareholders in the Spin-off.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The entire issued share
	capital of Sibanye Gold was unbundled to existing Gold Fields shareholders by way of a distribution in specie in accordance with section&nbsp;46 of the Companies Act, section&nbsp;46 of the Income Tax Act and the JSE Listing Requirements. The
	Sibanye Gold share capital was set such that the Sibanye Gold shares would be unbundled in a ratio of 1:1 with Gold Fields shares. Shareholder approval was not required for the Spin-off because Section&nbsp;5.85 of the JSE Listing Requirements
	allows for the pro rata distribution of a listed subsidiary to occur without shareholder approval provided that the subsidiary accounts for less than 50% of the total value of the parent company. The SARB has granted the necessary regulatory
	approvals for the distribution in specie. The Spin-off was governed by the laws of South Africa.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Trading of Sibanye Gold
	ordinary shares on the JSE and trading of Sibanye Gold ADRs on the NYSE on a conditional &#147;when-issued basis&#148; commenced on February&nbsp;11, 2013, or the List Date. &#147;When-issued&#148; trading refers to a sale or purchase of a security
	that is made conditionally because the security has been authorized but not yet issued or delivered. The &#147;when-issued&#148; trading market was a market for Sibanye Gold ADRs that were distributed to Gold Fields ADR holders on February&nbsp;20,
	2013, or the ADR Pay Date. This market allowed Gold Fields ADR holders to trade their entitlement to Sibanye Gold ADRs without trading their Gold Fields ADRs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Existing Gold Fields ADR holders holding as of the Record Date were able to continue trading their Gold Fields&#146; ADRs on the NYSE with the entitlement to Sibanye Gold ADRs until the ADR Pay Date in
	one of two ways. As discussed above, Gold Fields ADR holders were able to trade Gold Fields ADRs and Sibanye Gold ADRs separately on the NYSE as of the List Date. Such Gold Fields ADRs were traded on a &#147;trading-line&#148; basis and such Sibanye
	Gold ADRs were traded on a &#147;when-issued&#148; basis; however, the Sibanye Gold ADRs trading on a &#147;when-issued&#148; basis did not settle until after February&nbsp;21, 2013, or the ADR Ex-Date. Gold Fields ADR holders also had the ability
	to continue to trade their Gold Fields ADRs &#147;cum&#148; the Sibanye Gold ADR entitlement until the ADR Ex-Date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The board
	of directors of Gold Fields gave its in-principle approval for the Spin-off on November&nbsp;21, 2012, and, on November&nbsp;29, 2012, Gold Fields announced the Spin-off and the intention to list Sibanye Gold&#146;s shares on the JSE and its ADRs on
	the NYSE. The board of directors of Gold Fields passed the resolution necessary to implement the Spin-off on December&nbsp;12, 2012. On January&nbsp;10, 2013, Gold Fields shareholders were sent a detailed Preliminary Listing Statement, or PLS, which
	contains key information including the rationale for and mechanics of the unbundling, a timetable of events and financial effects of the distribution. The PLS was furnished to the SEC under cover of a Form 6-K on January&nbsp;10, 2013, and is also
	available on Sibanye Gold&#146;s website at www.sibanyegold.co.za and Gold Fields&#146; website at www.goldfields.co.za. Sibanye Gold shares were listed on the JSE and on the NYSE on a &#147;when issued&#148; basis on the List Date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Plan of Distribution
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The ADRs of Sibanye Gold, each representing four ordinary shares, are listed and traded on the NYSE (symbol
	&#147;SBGL&#148;). Outside the United States, Sibanye Gold&#146;s ordinary shares trade on the JSE&#146;s regulated market and are listed on the Official List of the JSE (symbol &#147;SGL&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A NAME="eolPage160"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	JSE Limited
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The JSE was formed in 1887. The JSE provides facilities for the buying and selling of a wide range of securities, including equity and corporate debt securities and warrants in respect of securities, as
	well as Krugerrands.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The JSE is a self-regulating organization operating under the ultimate supervision of the Ministry of
	Finance, through the Financial Services Board and its representative, the Registrar of Stock Exchanges. Following the introduction of the Stock Exchanges Control Amendment Act No.&nbsp;54 of 1995, or the Stock Exchange Act, which provides the
	statutory framework for the deregulation of the JSE, the JSE&#146;s rules were amended with effect from November&nbsp;8, 1995. These amendments removed the restrictions on corporate membership and allowed stockbrokers to form limited liability
	corporate entities. Members were, for the first time, also required to keep client funds in trust accounts separate from members&#146; own funds. Further rules to complete the deregulation of the JSE, as envisaged by the Stock Exchange Act, were
	promulgated during 1996 to permit members of the JSE to trade either as agents or as principals in any transaction in equities and to allow members to negotiate freely the brokerage commissions payable on agency transactions in equities. With effect
	from 1996, screen trading commenced on the JSE. The Securities Services Act No.&nbsp;36 of 2004 came into effect on January&nbsp;18, 2005. This act consolidates and amends the laws relating to the regulation and control of exchanges and securities
	trading, the regulation and control of central securities depositories and the custody and administration of securities and the prohibition of insider trading.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The market capitalization of companies listed on the stock exchange operated by the JSE Limited was approximately R8.4 trillion as of December&nbsp;31, 2012. The actual float available for public trading
	is significantly smaller than the aggregate market capitalization because of the large number of long-term holdings by listed holding companies in listed subsidiaries and associates, the existence of listed pyramid companies and cross-holdings
	between listed companies. Liquidity on the JSE (measured by reference to the total market value of securities traded as a percentage of the total market capitalization) was 43.1% for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;2012. Trading is concentrated
	in a small, but growing, number of companies. As of April 19, 2013, there were 395 listed companies on the JSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	South Africa
	was included in the Morgan Stanley Capital International Emerging Markets Free Index and the International Finance Corporation Investable Index in March and April 1995, respectively. South Africa has a significant representation in these emerging
	market indices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The JSE has established a project named Share Transactions Totally Electronic, or STRATE, which has involved
	the dematerialization of share certificates in a central securities depositary and the introduction of contractual, rolling, electronic settlement in order to increase the speed, certainty and efficiency of settlement and to fall into line with
	international practice. Gold Fields joined STRATE on October&nbsp;1, 2001. Investors are given the choice of either holding their securities in dematerialized form in the central securities depositary or retaining their share certificates.
	Shareholders who elect to retain their share certificates are not able to trade their shares on the JSE, although they may trade their shares off-market. Settlement of dematerialized shares traded electronically on the JSE is made five days after
	each trade (T+5).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Selling Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	the Issuer
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D475028D20F_HTM_ROM475028_12">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;10: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Memorandum of Incorporation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold is a public company registered in South Africa under the Companies Act, which limits the liability of its
	shareholders, and is governed by its Memorandum of Incorporation. Sibanye Gold&#146;s registration number is 2002/031431/07. Section&nbsp;3 of Sibanye Gold&#146;s Memorandum of Incorporation provides that its objectives are, among other things:
	(1)&nbsp;to purchase, lease or otherwise acquire mines, mineral and other properties, lands, farms and hereditaments; (2)&nbsp;to buy, sell, refine and deal in bullion, specie, coin and precious metals; and (3)&nbsp;to carry on any mining and
	metallurgical operation which may seem conducive to any of Sibanye Gold&#146;s objectives. On April&nbsp;8, 2009, South Africa passed the Companies Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Dividends and Payments to Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold may make payments
	(including the payment of dividends) to its shareholders from time to time in accordance with provisions of the Companies Act and the requirements of the JSE and the Memorandum of Incorporation. The Companies Act prohibits any payment (including the
	payment of any dividend) to a company&#146;s shareholders if there are reasonable grounds for believing that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	the company is, or would be, after the payment, unable to pay its debts as they become due in the ordinary course of business for a period of 12
	months after the date of making such payment; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	the consolidated assets of the company fairly valued would, after the payment, be less than the consolidated liabilities of the company, fairly
	valued.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Subject to the above requirements, the shareholders of Sibanye Gold in a general meeting or the
	Directors may from time to time declare a dividend or any other payment to be paid to shareholders and to the holders of share warrants (if any) in proportion to the number of shares held by them.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All unclaimed dividends or other payments to shareholders may be invested or otherwise made use of by the Directors for the benefit of
	Sibanye Gold until claimed, provided that any dividend or bonus or other payment to shareholders remaining unclaimed for a period of not less than three years from the date on which it became payable may be forfeited by resolution of the Directors
	for the benefit of Sibanye Gold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Voting Rights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Every shareholder of Sibanye Gold, or representative of a shareholder, who is present at a shareholders&#146; meeting has one vote on a show of hands, regardless of the number of shares he holds or
	represents or the number of shareholders he represents, unless a poll is demanded. Every Sibanye Gold shareholder is, on a poll, entitled to one vote per ordinary share held. A poll may be demanded by: (i)&nbsp;not less than five persons having the
	right to vote on that matter; or (ii)&nbsp;a person or persons entitled to exercise not less than one tenth of the total voting rights entitled to vote on that matter; or (iii)&nbsp;the chairperson of the meeting. Neither the Companies Act nor the
	Memorandum of Incorporation provide for cumulative voting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A shareholder is entitled to appoint a proxy to attend, speak and
	vote at any meeting on his or her behalf. The proxy need not be a shareholder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Issue of Additional Shares and Pre-emptive Rights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Shareholder approval is required for any issuance of additional shares, other than in the following circumstances &#150;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	a pro rata rights offer to all shareholders, provided that the shares subject to the offer are less than 30% of Sibanye Gold&#146;s issued share
	capital;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	154

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Shareholders, by ordinary resolution passed by a 75% majority, may either convey a general or specific authority to Directors to issue
	shares for cash. A general authority is valid until the earlier of the next annual general meeting and 15 months after the authority was granted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The JSE Listings Requirements as read with the Memorandum of Incorporation require that any new issue of equity shares by Sibanye Gold must first be offered to existing shareholders in proportion to their
	shareholding in Sibanye Gold unless, among other things, the issuance to new shareholders is:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>
	pursuant to a shareholder approved employee share incentive scheme;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	to raise cash through a general issuance at the discretion of the Directors to the general public (but not to related parties) of up to 10% of
	the issued share capital in any one fiscal year at an issue price with a discount not exceeding 10% of the 30-business-day weighted average trading price prior to the date the application is made to the JSE to list the shares, provided that a 75%
	majority of votes cast by shareholders at a general meeting must approve the granting of such authority to the Directors;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	to raise cash through a specific issuance of shares for cash, provided that 75% majority of shareholders, other than controlling shareholders,
	vote in favor of the resolution to issue the shares at a general meeting;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	a capitalization issue, an issue for an acquisition of assets (including another company) or an amalgamation or merger in terms of the Companies
	Act; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	in terms of option or conversion rights.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In terms of the Companies Act, an issue of equity shares by Sibanye Gold must be approved by a special resolution of Sibanye Gold&#146;s shareholders if the shares are issued, amongst other things, to:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</B>
	a Director, future director, prescribed officer, or future prescribed officer of Sibanye Gold;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</B>
	a person related or inter-related to Sibanye Gold, or to a Director or prescribed officer of Sibanye Gold, unless the issue of shares is,
	amongst other things:
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Furthermore, in terms of the Companies Act, an issue of shares requires approval of the shareholders by special resolution if the voting
	power of the class of shares that are issued or issuable as a result of the transaction will be equal to or exceed 30% of the voting power of all the shares of that class held by shareholders immediately before the transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Transfer of Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	transfer of any Sibanye Gold certificated share will be implemented in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Act using the then common form of transfer. Dematerialized shares which have been traded on the JSE are transferred on the STRATE
	system and delivered five business days after each trade. The transferor
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	155
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage163"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	of any share is deemed to remain the holder of that share until the name of the transferee is entered in Sibanye Gold&#146;s register for that share. Since Sibanye Gold shares are traded through
	STRATE, only shares which have been dematerialized may be traded on the JSE. Accordingly, Sibanye Gold shareholders who hold shares in certificated form will need to dematerialize their shares in order to trade on the JSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Disclosure of Interest in Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under South African law, a registered holder of Sibanye Gold shares who is not the beneficial owner of such shares is required to disclose the identify of the person on whose behalf that security is held
	and the identity of each person with a beneficial interest in the securities so held, the number and class of securities held for each such person with a beneficial interest, and the extent of each such person with a beneficial interest, and the
	extent of each such beneficial interest. This information must be disclosed in writing to Sibanye Gold within five business days after the end of every month during which a change has occurred in the information or more promptly or frequently to the
	extent so provided by the requirements of a central securities depository or otherwise be provided on payment of a prescribed fee charged by the registered holder of securities. Moreover, Sibanye Gold may, by notice in writing, require a person who
	is a registered shareholder, or whom Sibanye Gold knows or has reasonable cause to believe has a beneficial interest in Sibanye Gold ordinary shares, to confirm or deny whether or not such person holds the ordinary shares or beneficial interest and,
	if the ordinary shares are held for another person, to disclose to Sibanye Gold the identity of the person on whose behalf the ordinary shares are held. Sibanye Gold may also require the person to give particulars of the extent of the beneficial
	interest held during the three years preceding the date of the notice. Sibanye Gold is obligated to establish and maintain a register of the disclosures described above and to publish in its annual financial statements a list of the persons who hold
	a beneficial interest equal to or in excess of 5% of the total number of ordinary shares issued by Sibanye Gold, together with the extent of those beneficial interests. Further, in terms of section 122 of the Companies Act, a shareholder is required
	to notify Sibanye Gold within three business days if its shareholding crosses a 5% multiple measured against the issued shares at that time or if there is a change in shareholding exceeding 1% of the issued shares. Sibanye Gold is then required to
	disclose this notification to the South African Takeover Regulation Panel and deliver to the shareholders such notification by means of a SENS announcement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	General Meetings of Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Directors may convene general
	meetings of Sibanye Gold shareholders and a general meeting may also be convened on a requisition by shareholders made pursuant to the Companies Act. Sibanye Gold is obligated to hold an annual general meeting once in every calendar year, but no
	more than 15 months after the date of the previous annual general meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Annual general meetings and meetings calling for
	the passage of a special resolution require 15 clear days&#146; notice in writing of the place, day and time of the meeting to shareholders. Any other general meeting of Sibanye Gold shareholders requires at least 15 clear days&#146; notice in
	writing to shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Business may be transacted at any meeting of shareholders only while a quorum of shareholders is
	present. Three shareholders present personally or by representative and entitled to vote constitute a quorum for a general meeting and an annual general meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The annual general meeting deals with and disposes of all matters prescribed by the Memorandum of Incorporation and the Companies Act, including:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	the consideration of the audited financial statements and report of the independent accountants; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>
</B>
	the election of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Annual report and Accounts
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold is required to keep the accounting
	records and books of accounts as are necessary to present the state of affairs of Sibanye Gold and to explain the financial position of Sibanye Gold as prescribed by the
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	156
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Companies Act. No shareholder (who is not a Director) has the right to inspect any account or book or document of Sibanye Gold, except as conferred by the Companies Act or authorized by the
	Directors or by a resolution of Sibanye Gold in a general meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Directors will cause to be prepared annual financial
	statements and an annual report as required by the Companies Act and the JSE Listing Requirements. Sibanye Gold will send by mail to the registered address of every shareholder who so requests a copy of the annual report and annual financial
	statements. Not later than three months after the first six months of its fiscal year, Sibanye Gold will mail to every shareholder an interim report for the previous six-month period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Changes in Capital or Objects and Powers of Sibanye Gold
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Sibanye Gold
	shareholders may, by the passing of a special resolution:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

</B>
	increase Sibanye Gold&#146;s authorized share capital;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	divide all or any part of Sibanye Gold&#146;s share capital into shares of larger amounts than Sibanye Gold&#146;s existing shares or
	consolidate and reduce the number of the issued no par value shares, if any;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	subdivide all or any portion of Sibanye Gold&#146;s shares into shares of a smaller amount than is fixed by the Memorandum of Incorporation;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	convert all of Sibanye Gold&#146;s ordinary or preference share capital from having a par value into shares of no par value;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	reduce Sibanye Gold&#146;s authorized share capital and, if required by law, its issued share capital, stated capital and any capital redemption
	reserve fund or any share premium account;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	alter the provisions of the Memorandum of Incorporation with respect to the objects and powers of Sibanye Gold; and
</FONT>

</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	subject to the provisions of the Companies Act or any other South African law governing companies and the requirements of the JSE and any other
	stock exchange upon which the shares of Sibanye Gold may be quoted or listed from time to time, allow Sibanye Gold to acquire shares issued by itself or in any subsidiary of Sibanye Gold from time to time, and provided that:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
</B>
	the Directors may resolve that any return of capital made to all or any shareholders whose registered addresses are outside South Africa will,
	subject to any exchange control regulations then in force, be paid in such other currencies as may be stipulated by the Directors. The Directors may also stipulate the date for converting Rand to those currencies and the provisional rate of
	exchange, provided that the date for conversion must be within a period of 30 days prior to the date of payment; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold must hold all dividends due to shareholders in trust indefinitely, subject to the laws of prescription, and accordingly may release any
	dividends once the prescription period in relation to those dividends has expired.&nbsp;Sibanye Gold shall be entitled at any time to delegate its obligations in respect of unclaimed dividends or other unclaimed Distributions, to any of its bankers
	from time to time.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Variation of Rights
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All or any of the rights, privileges or conditions attached to Sibanye Gold&#146;s ordinary shares may be varied by a special resolution of Sibanye Gold passed in accordance with the provisions of the
	Companies Act; provided that, in circumstances where a shareholder dissents to such variation which materially and adversely affects his rights, that shareholder shall be entitled to be paid the fair value for his shares in accordance with the
	provisions of section 37(8) of the Companies Act as read with the appraisal remedies provided for in section 164 of the Companies Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Distribution of Assets on Liquidation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the event of a voluntary or compulsory liquidation, dissolution or winding-up, the assets remaining after payment of all the debts and liabilities of Sibanye Gold, including the costs of liquidation,
	shall be dealt with by a liquidator who may, with the sanction of a special resolution, among other things, divide among the shareholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	157
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage165"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D475028D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	any part of the assets of Sibanye Gold, and may vest any part of the assets of Sibanye Gold as the liquidator deems fit in trustees for the benefit of shareholders. The division of assets is not
	required to be done in accordance with the legal rights of shareholders of Sibanye Gold. In particular, any class may be given preferential or special rights or may be partly or fully excluded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Purchase of Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	Companies Act and the JSE Listing Requirements permit the establishment of share incentive trusts for the purpose of purchasing shares of a company for the benefit of its employees, including salaried Directors. These share incentive trusts are
	permitted to extend loans to company employees, other than non-salaried Directors, for the purpose of purchasing or subscribing for shares of the company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sibanye Gold may, if authorized by special resolution, acquire its own shares; provided that there are no reasonable grounds for believing that Sibanye Gold is or would be, after the payment, unable to
	pay its debts or that Sibanye Gold&#146;s consolidated assets would, after the payment, be less than its consolidated liabilities. The procedure for acquisition of shares by Sibanye Gold is regulated by the Memorandum of Incorporation, the Companies
	Act and the Listings Requirements of the JSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Borrowing Powers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Directors may exercise all the powers of Sibanye Gold to borrow money and to give all or any part of its property as security whether
	outright or as security for any debt, liability or obligation of Sibanye Gold or of any third-party. Sibanye Gold has unlimited borrowing powers. Furthermore, the Board may create and issue debt instruments as contemplated in section 43(1)(a) of the
	Companies Act, on such terms and conditions and in such manner as the Board may from time to time determine, in accordance with the requirements of section 43 of the Companies Act, provided that, for so long as Sibanye Gold is listed on the JSE, a
	debt instrument issued by Sibanye Gold may not grant special privileges regarding attending and voting at general meetings and the appointment of Directors, as contemplated in the listings requirements of the JSE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Directors&#146; borrowing powers may only be changed by special resolution of the shareholders amending the Memorandum of
	Incorporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The borrowing powers of the Directors have not been exceeded by the Directors in the previous three years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Non-South African Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There are no limitations imposed by South African law or by the Memorandum of Incorporation on the rights of non-South African shareholders to hold or vote Sibanye Gold&#146;s ordinary shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Rights of Minority Shareholders and Directors&#146; Duties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Majority shareholders of South African companies have no fiduciary obligations under South African common law to non-controlling shareholders. However, under the Companies Act, a shareholder may, under
	certain circumstances, seek relief from the court if he has been unfairly prejudiced by the company. There may also be common law personal actions available to a shareholder of a company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In South Africa, the common law and the Companies Act impose on Directors duties to, among other things, act with care, skill and
	diligence and to conduct the company&#146;s affairs honestly and in the best interests of the company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	158
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Additional Black Economic Empowerment Transactions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The BBBEE Act established a national policy on BBBEE with the objective of increasing the participation of HDSAs in the
	economy. Accordingly, on August&nbsp;5, 2010, Gold Fields announced a series of three empowerment transactions to meet its 2014 Black Economic Empowerment equity ownership requirements. On November&nbsp;2, 2010, the shareholders of Gold Fields
	approved these transactions at the general meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As part of the first transaction, on November&nbsp;19, 2010, Gold Fields
	issued 13,525,394 shares to the ESOP housed and administered by the Gold Fields Thusano Share Trust, thereby commencing the implementation of the ESOP transaction. Gold Fields facilitated the establishment of the ESOP in respect of 10.75% of Sibanye
	Gold. The holding in Sibanye Gold is equivalent to about 13.5&nbsp;million unencumbered Gold Fields shares with full voting rights, which were issued to and held by the trust at par value of R0.50 which represents a 99.5% discount to the 30-days
	volume-weighted average price at July&nbsp;30, 2010. This represented approximately 1.91% of the Gold Fields shares in issue. In accordance with the Spin-off, the Gold Fields Thusano Share Trust got 13,525,396 Sibanye Gold shares, which represents
	approximately 1.85% of the current Sibanye Gold shares in issue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The second transaction consisted of an issue to a BBBEE
	consortium as described below, or BEECO, of about 600,000 Gold Fields shares at par value of R0.50, representing a 99.5% discount to the 30-days volume-weighted average price at July&nbsp;30, 2010. This represented about 0.08% of the current Gold
	Fields shares in issue at that time. These shares carried no restrictions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As part of the third transaction, BEECO subscribed
	for a 10% holding with full voting rights directly in South Deep with a phased in participation over 20 years. As part of this transaction, Gold Fields transferred the ownership of the two entities holding interests in the South Deep mine from
	Sibanye Gold to a newly formed, 90% owned subsidiary of Gold Fields. This transaction was below the JSE transaction threshold of 5% and is not with related parties as defined as per the JSE Listing Requirements and is therefore included for
	information purposes only. These deals are central to Gold Fields&#146; and Sibanye Gold&#146;s objective to make every current employee at both companies an owner, while at the same time expanding opportunities for historically disadvantaged
	persons to benefit from the exploitation of the country&#146;s mineral resources by promoting broad-based ownership, employment, and the advancement of social and economic welfare generally.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	159
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
